debian/unstable.commit_message:
debian: Drop obsolete versioned dependency on lsb-base

The lsb-base package became a transitional package to sysvinit-utils
which is an essential package.

Signed-off-by: Benjamin Drung <bdrung@ubuntu.com>

Merge tag 'v47.0' into debian/unstable

rdma-core-47.0:

Updates from version 46.0
   * tests: Add event-enabled tests over SRD
   * tests: Add irdma_base.py
   * tests: Move attribute query out of base create_players
   * tests: Skip ack_timeout test for irdma devices
   * tests: Skip CQ shrinking for irdma devices
   * verbs: fix compilation warning with C++20
   * libhns: Fix the owner bit error of sq in new io
   * libhns: Fix reference to uninitialized cq pointer
   * libhns: Fix incorrect post-send with direct wqe of wr-list
   * libibverbs:Remove duplicate header files
   * providers/irdma: Fix CQ size validation
   * libibverbs: Fix ibv_devinfo help message
   * Fixed typo in ibv_alloc_parent_domain.3
   * libhns: Change arrangement in SL to adapt MPI APP
   * mlx5: Refactor how mlx5_vfio_reg_mr calculate the iova page size
   * util: Add an "alignment" parameter for iset_alloc_range()
   * tests: Test atomic traffic on DC
   * tests: Utilize user values for QPex atomic traffic
   * pyverbs: Add max_dc_rd_atom to Mlx5DVContext
   * mlx5: Expose max remote atomic/rdma read for DC
   * bnxt_re/lib: Enable low latency push
   * bnxt_re/lib: Refactor post_send and post_recv
   * Update kernel headers
   * build: include the module CheckCSourceCompiles
   * tests: Remove duplicated pre_run() code
   * tests: Remove duplicated resource creation code
   * stable: Tune stable branch creation process
   * README: Update minimum supported version to v28.x
   * bnxt_re/lib: Add support for send-with-invalidate
   * bnxt_re/lib: Optimize the post_recv routine
   * bnxt_re/lib: Avoid calling bnxt_re_is_chip_gen_p5 in data path
   * bnxt_re/lib: Remove the unwanted checks from data path
   * bnxt_re/lib: Reduce the RQ DB for a list of RX Work request
   * bnxt_re/lib: Fix fetch and add verification failure
   * tests: Fix wrong opcode for RC RDMA write test
   * bnxt_re/lib: Add device id for RoCE Hyper V VF
   * man page: correct IBV_ZERO_BASED to IBV_ACCESS_ZERO_BASED
   * bnxt_re/lib: Do not add QP to error list from terminal CQE if user destroys the QP
   * bnxt_re/lib: Reset the start_idx and last_idx during QP re-use
   * bnxt_re/lib: Cleanup CQ when QPs are moved to RESET from any other state
   * mlx5: DR, New ECPF checking
   * mlx5: DR, Cleanup the send function
   * mlx5: DR, Add missing action state for FDB push vlan states
   * mlx5: DR, Enable QP retransmission
   * libhns: Remove unnecessary QP checks
   * pyverbs: Remove include of bits/mman-linux.h
   * tests: Add SRD RDMA write tests on pyverbs
   * tests: Fix wrong send opcode use in traffic util
   * tests: Fix ambiguous use of qp opcode in traffic functions
   * tests: Fix double naming of remote address in players
   * tests: Add RDMA write with imm opcode to send util
   * redhat: Update source filename in spec file
   * Update library version to be 47.0

verbs: Add support for XDR speed in ibv_query_port

Previously we had 8 bit field to represent the link speed in query_port,
so speeds that were represented by the 9th bit couldn't be reported.

Add new u32 field to be able to report speeds that are in the 9th bit or
beyond. The old active speed field still reports the speed correctly, in
case the speed is lower than XDR, reports NDR otherwise.

In addition, speed_str() of ibv_devinfo was updated to consider the new
XDR rate, and read the rate from active_speed_ex when valid.

The ibv_query_port() man page was updated with the expected usage of
those two fields.

Signed-off-by: Or Har-Toov <ohartoov@nvidia.com>
Reviewed-by: Patrisious Haddad <phaddad@nvidia.com>

providers/irdma: Remove enum irdma_status_code

- Replaces the use of custom irdma status codes with linux error codes.

- Removes enum irdma_status_code and header file in which
  it was defined.

- Removes the excess 'ret' variables in some functions.
  As irdma_status_code is replaced with an int, there is no need for
  two variables to hold error codes.

- Removes redundant initializations which are no longer needed.

Signed-off-by: Krzysztof Czurylo <krzysztof.czurylo@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Tatyana Nikolova <tatyana.e.nikolova@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Leon Romanovsky <leon@kernel.org>

providers/irdma: Use HW specific minimum WQ size

HW GEN1 and GEN2 have different min WQ sizes but they are
currently set to the same value.

Use a gen specific attribute min_hw_wq_size and extend ABI to
pass it to user-space.

Signed-off-by: Sindhu Devale <sindhu.devale@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Shiraz Saleem <shiraz.saleem@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Tatyana Nikolova <tatyana.e.nikolova@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Leon Romanovsky <leon@kernel.org>

providers/irdma: Allow accurate reporting on QP max send/recv WR

Currently the attribute cap.max_send_wr and cap.max_recv_wr sent from
user-space during create QP are the provider computed SQ/RQ depth as
opposed to raw values passed from application. This inhibits computation
of an accurate value for max_send_wr and max_recv_wr for this QP in the
kernel which matches the value returned in user create QP. Also these
capabilities need to be reported from the driver in query QP.

Add support by extending the ABI to allow the raw cap.max_send_wr and
cap.max_recv_wr to be passed from user-space, while keeping
compatibility for the older scheme.

Add new helpers to assist with this: irdma_uk_calc_depth_shift_sq,
irdma_uk_calc_depth_shift_rq.

Signed-off-by: Shiraz, Saleem <shiraz.saleem@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Sagar, Youvaraj <youvaraj.sagar@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Tatyana Nikolova <tatyana.e.nikolova@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Leon Romanovsky <leon@kernel.org>

mlx5: Enhance SRQ performance

Enhance SRQ performance by revising the method of advancing to the next
WQE. Unlike the previous approach, which relied on the first freed WQE
as the next post receive target, the new algorithm locates the nearest
available WQE (or contiguous chunk of WQEs if available) to the tail
index.

A WQE is considered to be available when it's under SW ownership and is
not part of the SRQ queues (main/wait queue), in other words, it's not
included in the linked lists extending from the queues' head to tail.

In the context of ODP, where a page-faulted WQE requires Kernel
intervention to resolve and handle its addresses, a wait queue is used
as a cooldown mechanism. This mechanism places such WQEs in a wait queue
(or at the end of the main queue when a wait queue is unavailable),
delaying potential post-receives until they are properly handled.

Consequently, in the presence of a page-faulted WQE, the SRQ LL is
populated with all available WQEs, regardless of their contiguity,
reducing the risk of inadvertently overwriting a page-faulted WQE with a
future post-SRQ receive operation.

Here are some results from perftest traffic with max-wr size of 256 and
message size of 4KB (1KB as the max MTU on UD) on a ConnectX-6 Dx device
(results in Gb/sec):
+------+---------+-----------+----------+----------------+
| #QPs | QP Type |  W/O SRQ  | Prev SRQ |    New SRQ     |
+------+---------+-----------+----------+----------------+
|  10  |    UD   |   55.88   |   15.20  |  55.71 (+267%) |
|  10  |    RC   |   92.58   |   60.67  |  79.85 (+31%)  |
|   5  |    RC   |   92.57   |   58.08  |  86.24 (+48%)  |
|   3  |    RC   |   92.57   |   59.33  |  91.94 (+55%)  |
+------+---------+-----------+----------+----------------+

Signed-off-by: Edward Srouji <edwards@nvidia.com>
Signed-off-by: Yishai Hadas <yishaih@nvidia.com>

mlx5: DR, Fix dest-root-table action for NIC TX

The devx query function does not set the ICM address correctly to tx_icm
for NIC TX table.
The correct logic is: for NIC_RX or NIC_TX, icm_address_0 should be
used, for FDB, icm_address_0 used for RX and icm_address_1 for TX.
As a result when forwarding traffic to a a NIC TX FW FT using
dest-root-table action an incorrect ICM address would be used.

Fixes: 8eac40cd0b7f ("mlx5: DR, Add query support for FW owned FT")
Signed-off-by: Alex Vesker <valex@nvidia.com>
Reviewed-by: Erez Shitrit <erezsh@nvidia.com>
Signed-off-by: Yishai Hadas <yishaih@nvidia.com>

efa: Change resource deallocation order in QP and CQ

When trying to destroy QP or CQ, we first release rdma-core resources
for the relevant object (mapping for address ranges, refcounts, locks
etc.) and only then request the driver to destroy the object. If the
driver or the device fails, the object isn't fully destroyed so the user
can try to destroy the object again which will lead to trying to release
already released rdma-core resources for the object.
Change deallocation order to first call kernel and driver code and if
succeeded release rdma-core resources.

Signed-off-by: Yonatan Nachum <ynachum@amazon.com>

bnxt_re/lib: Implement doorbell pacing algorithm

User applications check the doorbell FIFO congestion
at default probability while ringing the doorbell.
If the doorbell FIFO threshold is higher than the
pacing threshold, waits before ringing the doorbell.
If the FIFO threshold is higher than the alarm threshold,
notifies the driver through uapi, and the driver
updates the shared page which will make sure all the
applications to pace the doorbell ringing.

mlx5: DR, Add check for unsupported and reserved fields in match param

When a matcher is being built, we "consume" (clear) mask fields one by
one, and to verify that we do support all the required fields we check
if the whole mask was consumed, else the matching request includes
unsupported and reserved fields.

In addition, in order to use the existing macros for reading the
matcher's fields, the reserved fields that are larger than 32 bits were
split into 32 bit fields.

Signed-off-by: Hamdan Igbaria <hamdani@nvidia.com>
Signed-off-by: Alex Vesker <valex@nvidia.com>
Signed-off-by: Yishai Hadas <yishaih@nvidia.com>

mlx5: DR, Remove table level check

To prevent loops a check was done to fail on connecting tables to lower
levels.
Since SWS is allowed only on trusted systems, with privileged users,
current decision is to leave loop prevention for the privileged user to
deal with, in this case a user can build more complex table trees and
reuse the same table, for example using the same 5tuple match table for
inner and outer, by decapsulating and jumping to the same table.

Signed-off-by: Alex Vesker <valex@mellanox.com>
Signed-off-by: Hamdan Igbaria <hamdani@nvidia.com>
Signed-off-by: Yishai Hadas <yishaih@nvidia.com>

mlx5: DR, Support new sizes for pre-allocated fixed matcher tables

Add larger size options(4096K, 8192K and 16384K) to dr_icm_chunk_size.
This sizes will only be used for pre-allocated fixed matcher tables when
the user will send a hint for the number of rules to be used.
These new sizes will not impact on regular rehash and keep current
limitations for max rehashed size.

Signed-off-by: Hamdan Igbaria <hamdani@nvidia.com>
Signed-off-by: Alex Vesker <valex@nvidia.com>
Signed-off-by: Yishai Hadas <yishaih@nvidia.com>

mlx5: DR, In rehash write the line in the entry immediately

And don't wait for the whole table to be ready.
This way we save allocations of the ste_info structure and improve
performance.

Signed-off-by: Erez Shitrit <erezsh@nvidia.com>
Signed-off-by: Hamdan Igbaria <hamdani@nvidia.com>
Signed-off-by: Alex Vesker <valex@nvidia.com>
Signed-off-by: Yishai Hadas <yishaih@nvidia.com>

mlx5: DR, While deleting rule don't update the last STE in htbl

In the process of deleting a rule, if we are deleting the last rule in
the htable, no need to update that rule because the htable will be
deleted right after, so skip the STE update and continue to the htable
deleting.
This will reduce an extra ICM write which can improve the deletion rate.

Signed-off-by: Erez Shitrit <erezsh@nvidia.com>
Signed-off-by: Hamdan Igbaria <hamdani@nvidia.com>
Signed-off-by: Alex Vesker <valex@nvidia.com>
Signed-off-by: Yishai Hadas <yishaih@nvidia.com>

tests: Test extension for match on bth_a

An additional field match is added to the test.
The bit is 'a' A.K.A acknowledgment bit as part of the ib_bth header.

Signed-off-by: Itamar Gozlan <igozlan@nvidia.com>
Signed-off-by: Edward Srouji <edwards@nvidia.com>

mlx5: DR, Adding support for matching on bth_a bit

The BTH header is part of the RoCE v2 packet format. The acknowledgment
bit of the BTH header, a.k.a bth_a, indicates that the responder should
schedule an acknowledgment (for this packet).
This patch extends the support to match on bth_a field in the BTH header
layout in STE V1 format. Previously, only opcode and qp were supported.
Now, the match is enabled for field bth_a also.

Signed-off-by: Itamar Gozlan <igozlan@nvidia.com>
Reviewed-by: Yevgeny Kliteynik <kliteyn@nvidia.com>
Signed-off-by: Yishai Hadas <yishaih@nvidia.com>

providers/irdma: Remove enum irdma_status_code

- Replaces the use of custom irdma status codes with linux error codes.

- Removes enum irdma_status_code and header file in which
  it was defined.

- Removes the excess 'ret' variables in some functions.
  As irdma_status_code is replaced with an int, there is no need for
  two variables to hold error codes.

- Removes redundant initializations which are no longer needed.

Signed-off-by: Krzysztof Czurylo <krzysztof.czurylo@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Tatyana Nikolova <tatyana.e.nikolova@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Leon Romanovsky <leon@kernel.org>

providers/irdma: Use HW specific minimum WQ size

HW GEN1 and GEN2 have different min WQ sizes but they are
currently set to the same value.

Use a gen specific attribute min_hw_wq_size and extend ABI to
pass it to user-space.

Signed-off-by: Sindhu Devale <sindhu.devale@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Shiraz Saleem <shiraz.saleem@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Tatyana Nikolova <tatyana.e.nikolova@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Leon Romanovsky <leon@kernel.org>

providers/irdma: Allow accurate reporting on QP max send/recv WR

Currently the attribute cap.max_send_wr and cap.max_recv_wr sent from
user-space during create QP are the provider computed SQ/RQ depth as
opposed to raw values passed from application. This inhibits computation
of an accurate value for max_send_wr and max_recv_wr for this QP in the
kernel which matches the value returned in user create QP. Also these
capabilities need to be reported from the driver in query QP.

Add support by extending the ABI to allow the raw cap.max_send_wr and
cap.max_recv_wr to be passed from user-space, while keeping
compatibility for the older scheme.

Add new helpers to assist with this: irdma_uk_calc_depth_shift_sq,
irdma_uk_calc_depth_shift_rq.

Signed-off-by: Shiraz, Saleem <shiraz.saleem@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Sagar, Youvaraj <youvaraj.sagar@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Tatyana Nikolova <tatyana.e.nikolova@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Leon Romanovsky <leon@kernel.org>

mlx5: Enhance SRQ performance

Enhance SRQ performance by revising the method of advancing to the next
WQE. Unlike the previous approach, which relied on the first freed WQE
as the next post receive target, the new algorithm locates the nearest
available WQE (or contiguous chunk of WQEs if available) to the tail
index.

A WQE is considered to be available when it's under SW ownership and is
not part of the SRQ queues (main/wait queue), in other words, it's not
included in the linked lists extending from the queues' head to tail.

In the context of ODP, where a page-faulted WQE requires Kernel
intervention to resolve and handle its addresses, a wait queue is used
as a cooldown mechanism. This mechanism places such WQEs in a wait queue
(or at the end of the main queue when a wait queue is unavailable),
delaying potential post-receives until they are properly handled.

Consequently, in the presence of a page-faulted WQE, the SRQ LL is
populated with all available WQEs, regardless of their contiguity,
reducing the risk of inadvertently overwriting a page-faulted WQE with a
future post-SRQ receive operation.

Here are some results from perftest traffic with max-wr size of 256 and
message size of 4KB (1KB as the max MTU on UD) on a ConnectX-6 Dx device
(results in Gb/sec):
+------+---------+-----------+----------+----------------+
| #QPs | QP Type |  W/O SRQ  | Prev SRQ |    New SRQ     |
+------+---------+-----------+----------+----------------+
|  10  |    UD   |   55.88   |   15.20  |  55.71 (+267%) |
|  10  |    RC   |   92.58   |   60.67  |  79.85 (+31%)  |
|   5  |    RC   |   92.57   |   58.08  |  86.24 (+48%)  |
|   3  |    RC   |   92.57   |   59.33  |  91.94 (+55%)  |
+------+---------+-----------+----------+----------------+

Signed-off-by: Edward Srouji <edwards@nvidia.com>
Signed-off-by: Yishai Hadas <yishaih@nvidia.com>

mlx5: DR, Fix dest-root-table action for NIC TX

The devx query function does not set the ICM address correctly to tx_icm
for NIC TX table.
The correct logic is: for NIC_RX or NIC_TX, icm_address_0 should be
used, for FDB, icm_address_0 used for RX and icm_address_1 for TX.
As a result when forwarding traffic to a a NIC TX FW FT using
dest-root-table action an incorrect ICM address would be used.

Fixes: 8eac40cd0b7f ("mlx5: DR, Add query support for FW owned FT")
Signed-off-by: Alex Vesker <valex@nvidia.com>
Reviewed-by: Erez Shitrit <erezsh@nvidia.com>
Signed-off-by: Yishai Hadas <yishaih@nvidia.com>

efa: Change resource deallocation order in QP and CQ

When trying to destroy QP or CQ, we first release rdma-core resources
for the relevant object (mapping for address ranges, refcounts, locks
etc.) and only then request the driver to destroy the object. If the
driver or the device fails, the object isn't fully destroyed so the user
can try to destroy the object again which will lead to trying to release
already released rdma-core resources for the object.
Change deallocation order to first call kernel and driver code and if
succeeded release rdma-core resources.

Signed-off-by: Yonatan Nachum <ynachum@amazon.com>

bnxt_re/lib: Implement doorbell pacing algorithm

User applications check the doorbell FIFO congestion
at default probability while ringing the doorbell.
If the doorbell FIFO threshold is higher than the
pacing threshold, waits before ringing the doorbell.
If the FIFO threshold is higher than the alarm threshold,
notifies the driver through uapi, and the driver
updates the shared page which will make sure all the
applications to pace the doorbell ringing.

mlx5: DR, Optimize args sending on QP while in multi QP

In multi QP delay the write of the args to the rule creating
phase, on the same QP of the rule using the action, this way
we will save writing of the args on all the QPs when creating
it while the multi QP feature is enabled.

Signed-off-by: Hamdan Igbaria <hamdani@nvidia.com>
Signed-off-by: Alex Vesker <valex@nvidia.com>
Signed-off-by: Yishai Hadas <yishaih@nvidia.com>

mlx5: DR, Add check for unsupported and reserved fields in match param

When a matcher is being built, we "consume" (clear) mask fields one by
one, and to verify that we do support all the required fields we check
if the whole mask was consumed, else the matching request includes
unsupported and reserved fields.

In addition, in order to use the existing macros for reading the
matcher's fields, the reserved fields that are larger than 32 bits were
split into 32 bit fields.

Signed-off-by: Hamdan Igbaria <hamdani@nvidia.com>
Signed-off-by: Alex Vesker <valex@nvidia.com>
Signed-off-by: Yishai Hadas <yishaih@nvidia.com>

mlx5: DR, Remove table level check

To prevent loops a check was done to fail on connecting tables to lower
levels.
Since SWS is allowed only on trusted systems, with privileged users,
current decision is to leave loop prevention for the privileged user to
deal with, in this case a user can build more complex table trees and
reuse the same table, for example using the same 5tuple match table for
inner and outer, by decapsulating and jumping to the same table.

Signed-off-by: Alex Vesker <valex@mellanox.com>
Signed-off-by: Hamdan Igbaria <hamdani@nvidia.com>
Signed-off-by: Yishai Hadas <yishaih@nvidia.com>

mlx5: DR, Support new sizes for pre-allocated fixed matcher tables

Add larger size options(4096K, 8192K and 16384K) to dr_icm_chunk_size.
This sizes will only be used for pre-allocated fixed matcher tables when
the user will send a hint for the number of rules to be used.
These new sizes will not impact on regular rehash and keep current
limitations for max rehashed size.

Signed-off-by: Hamdan Igbaria <hamdani@nvidia.com>
Signed-off-by: Alex Vesker <valex@nvidia.com>
Signed-off-by: Yishai Hadas <yishaih@nvidia.com>

mlx5: DR, In rehash write the line in the entry immediately

And don't wait for the whole table to be ready.
This way we save allocations of the ste_info structure and improve
performance.

Signed-off-by: Erez Shitrit <erezsh@nvidia.com>
Signed-off-by: Hamdan Igbaria <hamdani@nvidia.com>
Signed-off-by: Alex Vesker <valex@nvidia.com>
Signed-off-by: Yishai Hadas <yishaih@nvidia.com>

mlx5: DR, While deleting rule don't update the last STE in htbl

In the process of deleting a rule, if we are deleting the last rule in
the htable, no need to update that rule because the htable will be
deleted right after, so skip the STE update and continue to the htable
deleting.
This will reduce an extra ICM write which can improve the deletion rate.

Signed-off-by: Erez Shitrit <erezsh@nvidia.com>
Signed-off-by: Hamdan Igbaria <hamdani@nvidia.com>
Signed-off-by: Alex Vesker <valex@nvidia.com>
Signed-off-by: Yishai Hadas <yishaih@nvidia.com>

An additional field match is added to the test.
The bit is 'a' A.K.A acknowledgment bit as part of the ib_bth header.

Signed-off-by: Itamar Gozlan <igozlan@nvidia.com>
Signed-off-by: Edward Srouji <edwards@nvidia.com>

mlx5: DR, Adding support for matching on bth_a bit

The BTH header is part of the RoCE v2 packet format. The acknowledgment
bit of the BTH header, a.k.a bth_a, indicates that the responder should
schedule an acknowledgment (for this packet).
This patch extends the support to match on bth_a field in the BTH header
layout in STE V1 format. Previously, only opcode and qp were supported.
Now, the match is enabled for field bth_a also.

Signed-off-by: Itamar Gozlan <igozlan@nvidia.com>
Reviewed-by: Yevgeny Kliteynik <kliteyn@nvidia.com>
Signed-off-by: Yishai Hadas <yishaih@nvidia.com>
